snippet.title: Polymega Gameplays - Atari Anniversary Edition Redux [PlayStation - PAL]
snippet.description:
Unlike the Dreamcast version, simply called Atari Anniversary Edition, this PS1 release replaces Crystal Castles and Millipede with Black Widow and Space Duel

Games:
01:31 - Asteroids
05:10 - Asteroids Deluxe
06:50 - BattleZone
09:50 - Black Widow (Plays best with an Analog or DualShock controller)
12:36 - Centipede
14:29 - Gravitar (My LEAST favorite Atari arcade game, as always)
18:15 - Missile Command
21:15 - PONG (I don't know why, but I think there may be some input lag issues on the wireless controller... right?)
23:43 - Space Duel
27:13 - Super Breakout (Same problem I have as PONG, perhaps?)
29:07 - Tempest
31:40 - Warlords

Asteroids, Asteroids Deluxe, Space Duel, Black Widow, Centpede, Gravitar, Missile Command, PONG, Super Breakout, Tempest, Warlords (C) Atari SA
BattleZone (C) Rebellion
Developed by Digital Eclipse
BIOS Used: Polymega BIOS
Also released on PC, Dreamcast and Game Boy Advance

#retrogames #retrogaming #polymega #polymegagameplays #ps1 #psx #psone #playstation #atari #atarianniversaryeditionredux

NOTE: I apologise if I happen to suck in some of the games, that usually doesn't happen to me. Being that I grew up with PAL versions, I imagine there might be SOME issue with the input lag on the Polymega Universal Wireless Controller. At least I think so, anyway.

PERSONAL HISTORY: I remember this PS1 version being re-released on the PlayStation Store as part of the PSone Classics line back in my younger years, when I still had my PSP and PS3. In fact, it was one of the games I played during my stay in France back in 2011 (which, by the way, I was unaware of the infamous 2011 PSN hack, since I wasn't home at the time).
